entry.title: Top diplomats from Armenia and Turkey hold rare meeting in Iran

media:group.media:title: Top diplomats from Armenia and Turkey hold rare meeting in Iran
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenia, Azerbaijan, Iran, Russia, and Turkey stressed the need for peace in the South Caucasus in a joint communiqu√© following a first-of-its-kind ‚Äò3+3‚Äô summit. üìçCanadian Foreign Minister M√©lanie Joly is due to arrive in Armenia to open Canada‚Äôs new embassy in Yerevan and meet with senior officials. üìçArmenia and France signed a major arms deal, marking the first time Yerevan has purchased Western-made weapons.

entry.title: Armenia signs first-of-its-kind arms deal with France

media:group.media:title: Armenia signs first-of-its-kind arms deal with France
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenia and France are expected to sign a first-of-its-kind arms deal that will allow Yerevan to purchase defensive weapons from Paris. üìçArmenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan traveled to Tehran to meet with his counterparts from Azerbaijan, Iran, Russia, and Turkey at a ‚Äò3+3‚Äô summit. üìçArmenia will provide two additional payments of $125 each to every forcibly displaced person from Nagorno-Karabakh. üìçThe Armenian government appointed career diplomat Karen Israyelyan to head Armenia‚Äôs consulate in Los Angeles.

entry.title: On the frontlines, volunteers in Syunik share stories of hope and heartbreak

media:group.media:title: On the frontlines, volunteers in Syunik share stories of hope and heartbreak
media:group.media:description:
On September 24, tens of thousands of Armenians began to flee their homes in Nagorno-Karabakh and make the arduous journey to Armenia‚Äôs bordering region of Syunik. After nearly a year of blockade and violence, many arrived hungry, ill, and with only the most minimal of belongings. In the midst of this ethnic cleansing, both local and international organizations, along with over 1,000 volunteers from the Syunik region, worked diligently to register, distribute food and clothing, and offer crucial psychological support. The student teams from Goris State University in Syunik were among the earliest to undertake these challenging and vital responsibilities. CivilNet interviewed some of these dedicated volunteers, who shared compelling stories from the people of Artsakh.

media:group.media:description:
üìçThe credit rating agency Fitch declined to lower Armenia‚Äôs sovereign credit rating following Azerbaijan‚Äôs lightning offensive against Nagorno-Karabakh last month. üìç‚ÄòThe Armenian economy‚Äôs growth rates will remain high until the end of the year,‚Äô the Eurasian Development Bank forecast in its latest regional macroeconomic report. üìçArmenia has approached Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates with a proposal to invest in a planned industrial park and special economic zone in the city of Gyumri.
